did.abstract: Collection consists of a letter from Clarke's son, William R. Clarke, a sergeant in the Union Army, written on May 15 while he was stationed in Keokuk, Iowa. Clarke mentions Jefferson Davis, his good wages, and his future plans. The lettersheets include three woodcuts depicting the Battle of Pittsburg Landing, the Bombardment of Ft. Henry, and the Bombardment of Island No. 10.
